alert.note: Alert for Lewis (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 07 at 3:40AM EDT until October 07 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN LEWIS COUNTY... At 340 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rain across the area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in a narrow band from Lewis to Port Leyden and Greig. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lyonsdale, Greig, Port Leyden, Lyons Falls, Constableville, Turin, Brantingham, Sperryville, Talcottville, Mohawk Hill and West Leyden. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
